semantic_title: Non-healing Burns - Acute Burn Code Assignment
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Injury, Poisoning, and Certain Other Consequences of External Causes > d. Coding of Burns and Corrosions > 3) Non-healing burns

content.full_text: Non-healing burns are coded as acute burns. Necrosis of burned skin should be coded as a non-healed burn. (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L83)
content.summary: Coding rule for non-healing burns and necrotic burn tissue, requiring acute burn codes rather than sequela codes (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L83)
key_concepts: Non-healing burns as acute burns (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L82)
Necrosis coding as non-healed burn (Evidence: pg no: 81, L82-L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Non-healing burns are coded as acute burns (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L82)
detailed_rules.explanation: Burns that fail to heal properly should be coded using acute burn codes, not sequela codes (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L82)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Necrosis of burned skin should be coded as a non-healed burn (Evidence: pg no: 81, L82-L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: Necrotic tissue in burn areas is considered a non-healed burn and coded accordingly (Evidence: pg no: 81, L82-L83)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Determine if burn is non-healing or necrotic
Step 3: Assign acute burn code (not sequela)
Step 4: Include appropriate 7th character for encounter type

correct_coding.sequencing: Acute burn code with appropriate 7th character
correct_coding.rationale: Non-healing burns are coded as acute burns, not sequelae (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L82)

codes: Burn sequela or late effect code
incorrect_coding.rationale: Non-healing burns should not be coded as sequelae
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using sequela codes for non-healing burns

Step 4: Do not use separate necrosis code

correct_coding.rationale: Necrosis of burned skin is coded as non-healed burn (Evidence: pg no: 81, L82-L83)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Necrosis should be coded as part of non-healed burn
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Adding separate codes for burn necrosis

warnings: Do not use sequela codes for non-healing burns (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L82)
best_practices: Code non-healing burns as acute burns regardless of time elapsed (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L82)
Include necrosis as part of non-healed burn coding (Evidence: pg no: 81, L82-L83)
common_mistakes: Using sequela codes for non-healing burns (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L82)
Coding necrosis separately from burn (Evidence: pg no: 81, L82-L83)
tips: Non-healing status determines coding approach, not time elapsed (Evidence: pg no: 81, L81-L82)
implementation_notes: Requires assessment of healing status rather than chronological age of burn
clinical_context: Important for wound care and burn treatment coding
